tit.cmt: tower を pagoda に修正しました。（共有登録用語でもあり、意味もこちらの方が正確だと思われます。）

sen.j: 宝篋印塔（ほうきょういんとう）は、墓塔・供養塔などに使われる仏塔の一種である。
sen.e: A hokyoin-to tower is a kind of Buddhist pagoda which is used as a tomb or a tower for consolation of the spirit of the dead.
A hokyoin-to pagoda is a kind of Buddhist pagoda which is used as a tomb tower and memorial tower.
sen.cmt: tower を pagoda に修正しました。 a tomb or a tower for consolation of the spirit of the dead を a tomb tower and memorial tower に修正しました。
sen.e: A hokyoin-to pagoda is a kind of Buddhist pagoda which is used as a tomb tower and memorial tower.

sen.j: 五輪塔とともに、石造の遺品が多い。
sen.e: As with 'gorinto' (five-ringed towers), many hokyoin-to tower remains are made of stone.
As with gorinto (a grave marker or cenotaph erected for the repose of the departed), many hokyoin-to pagodas are made of stone.
sen.cmt: gorinto' (five-ringed towers) を gorinto (a grave marker or cenotaph erected for the repose of the departed) に修正しました。（下記参照しました：http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/5-elements-pagoda-gravestone.html）tower を pagodas に修正しました。
sen.e: As with gorinto (a grave marker or cenotaph erected for the repose of the departed), many hokyoin-to pagodas are made of stone.

sen.j: 中国の呉越王銭弘俶（せんこうしゅく）が延命を願って、諸国に立てた8万4千塔の形をまねて簡略化したものだとされている。
sen.e: It is said that a hokyoin-to tower is a simplified imitation of the 84,000 towers which Qian Chu, the King of Wuyue in China, built in his various territories hoping for prolongation of his life.
It is said that a hokyoin-to pagoda is a simplified imitation of the 84,000 pagodas which Qian Chu, the King of Wuyue in China, built in his various territories hoping for prolongation of his life.
sen.cmt: tower を pagoda に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that a hokyoin-to pagoda is a simplified imitation of the 84,000 pagodas which Qian Chu, the King of Wuyue in China, built in his various territories hoping for prolongation of his life.

sen.j: これは、インドのアショーカ王が釈迦の入滅後立てられた8本の塔のうち7本から仏舎利を取り出して、新たに8万4千塔に分納したという故事に習ったものだという。
sen.e: It is said that this followed the ancient event of the King Ashoka in India taking Buddha's relics out of seven of the eight towers which were built after the Buddha's death, and restoring them in 84,000 towers.
sen.cmt: 「習った」は「倣った」の誤りと考えて訳しました。
sen.e: It is said that this followed the historical fact of King Ashoka in India taking Buddha's relics out of seven of the eight pagodas which had been built after Buddha's death, and restoring them in 84,000 pagodas.
sen.cmt: the ancient event を the histrical fact に修正しました。were built を had been built に修正しました。King および Buddha's の前の the を削除しました。towers を pagodas に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that this followed the historical fact of King Ashoka in India taking Buddha's relics out of seven of the eight pagodas which had been built after Buddha's death, and restoring them in 84,000 pagodas.

sen.j: 日本には鎌倉中期以後に造立が盛んになった。
sen.e: In Japan, many hokyoin-to towers started being built after the mid-Kamakura period.
In Japan, many hokyoin-to pagodas were built after the middle of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: started being を were に修正しました。towers を pagodas に修正しました。
sen.e: In Japan, many hokyoin-to pagodas were built after the middle of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 名称は、宝篋印陀羅尼（宝篋印心咒経/ほうきょういんしんじゅきょう）を納めたことによる。
sen.e: The name of hokyoin-to tower drives from the fact that 'hokyoin darani', or 'hokyoin shinjukyo' (hokyoin ritual speeches or spells) were stored in it.
The name of hokyoin-to pagoda derives from the fact that hokyoin darani (hokyoin shinjukyo [hokyoin sutra]) were stored in it.
sen.cmt: hokyoin darani', or 'hokyoin shinjukyo' (hokyoin ritual speeches or spells) を hokyoin darani (hokyoin shinjukyo [hokyoin sutra]) に修正しました。
sen.e: The name of hokyoin-to pagoda derives from the fact that hokyoin darani (hokyoin shinjukyo [hokyoin sutra]) were stored in it.

sen.j: ただし、他のものを納めていても同形のものは、すべて宝篋印塔と呼ぶ。
sen.e: However even if other things are stored in them, the towers of the same shape are all called hokyoin-to towers.
However, all the pagodas of the same shape, even if other things are stored in them, are called hokyoin-to pagodas.
sen.cmt: 部分的に入れ替えて、towers を pagodas に修正しました。
sen.e: However, all the pagodas of the same shape, even if other things are stored in them, are called hokyoin-to pagodas.

sen.j: 本来的には、基礎に宝篋印心咒経の文字を刻む。
sen.e: Originally the wording of hokyoin shinjukyo was inscribed in the foundation of the tower.
Originally, the characters 宝篋印心咒経 (hokyoin shinjukyo) were inscribed in the foundations of the pagoda.
sen.cmt: wording of hokyoin shinjukyo was を characters 宝篋印心咒経 (hokyoin shinjukyo) were に修正し、founf\dation を複数形に修正しました。tower を pagoda に修正しました。
sen.e: Originally, the characters 宝篋印心咒経 (hokyoin shinjukyo) were inscribed in the foundations of the pagoda.

sen.j: 五輪塔と同じく密教系の塔で、鎌倉期以降宗派を問わず造立されるようになった。
sen.e: As with gorinto, hokyoin-to are the towers of Esoteric Buddhism and they started to be built after the Kamakura period, regardless of religious school.
As with gorinto, hokyoin-to pagodas are a feature of Esoteric Buddhism, and started to be built regardless of the religious school after the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: pagodas を追記し、 the towers of を a feature of に修正しました。and they を , and に修正しました。religious school の前に the を追記しました。文意を明確にするために、 regardless of the religious school と after the Kamakura period を入れ替えました。
sen.e: As with gorinto, hokyoin-to pagodas are a feature of Esoteric Buddhism, and started to be built regardless of the religious school after the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 最上部の棒状の部分は相輪と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The topmost stick shaped part of the tower is called 'sorin.'
The uppermost stick shaped part of the pagoda is called 'sorin.'
sen.cmt: topmost を uppermost に、tower を pagoda に修正しました。
sen.e: The uppermost stick shaped part of the pagoda is called 'sorin.'

sen.j: 相輪は、頂上に宝珠をのせ、その下に請花（うけばな）、九輪（宝輪）、伏鉢などと呼ばれる部分がある。
sen.e: A sorin has a sacred gem (hoju in Japanese) on its peak and under the gem it consists of the parts such as a 'ukebana' (a catching flower), 'kurin' (nine rings, a.k.a horin) and a 'fusebachi' (a turned-down bowl).

A sorin has a sacred gem (hoju in Japanese) at its peak and under the gem it consists of the parts such as a ukebana (lotus-shaped support of a seat, pedestal or pagoda finial), kurin (nine vertically stacked rings of a pagoda finial) and a fukubachi (inverted bowl-shaped part of a pagoda finial).
sen.cmt: on its peak を at its peak に修正しました。請花と九輪（宝輪）の説明、および伏鉢の読み方と説明を修正しました。
sen.e: A sorin has a sacred gem (hoju in Japanese) at its peak and under the gem it consists of the parts such as a ukebana (lotus-shaped support of a seat, pedestal or pagoda finial), kurin (nine vertically stacked rings of a pagoda finial) and a fukubachi (inverted bowl-shaped part of a pagoda finial).

sen.j: 相輪は宝篋印塔以外にも、宝塔、多宝塔、層塔などにも見られる。
sen.e: Besides hokyoin-to towers, sorin can also be seen on 'hoto' (treasure tower), tahoto (many-treasured tower), 'soto' (multi-storied tower) and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Besides hokyoin-to pagodas, sorin can also be seen on hoto (treasure pagoda), tahoto pagoda (a "multi-treasure" pagoda), soto (multi-storied pagoda) and so on.
sen.cmt: hokyoin-to towers を hokyoin-to pagoda に、また各塔の説明を修正しました。
sen.e: Besides hokyoin-to pagodas, sorin can also be seen on hoto (treasure pagoda), tahoto pagoda (a "multi-treasure" pagoda), soto (multi-storied pagoda) and so on.

sen.j: 単なる飾りではなく、釈迦の遺骨を祀る「ストゥーパ」の原型を残した部分である。
sen.e: A sorin is not just ornamental, but the part which leaves the archetype of a 'stupa' setting up Buddha's cremains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The sorin is not just ornamental: it retains the original form of a 'stupa' worshipping Buddha's cremains.
The sorin is not just ornamental: it retains the original form of a 'stupa' worshipping Buddha's cremains.

sen.j: 相輪の下には笠があり、この笠の四隅には隅飾（すみかざり）と呼ばれる突起がある。
sen.e: There is a cap under a sorin and the cap has protuberances called 'sumikazari' (corner decorations) on its four corners.
There is a cap under a sorin and the cap has protuberances called 'sumikazari' (corner decorations) on its four corners.
There is a cap under a sorin and the cap has protuberances called 'sumikazari' (corner decorations) on its four corners.

sen.j: 笠の下の方形の部分は、塔身（とうしん）、さらにその下の方形部分は基礎と呼ばれる。
sen.e: A square part under the cap is called 'toshin' (tower body) and another square part further below is called 'kiso' (base).
A square part under the cap is called toshin (pagoda body) and another square part further below is called kiso (base).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマークを外し、ｔｏｗｅｒ を ｐａｇｏｄａ に修正しました。
sen.e: A square part under the cap is called toshin (pagoda body) and another square part further below is called kiso (base).

sen.j: この塔身部に四角の輪郭が刻まれずに基礎部の格座間が一つの型が関西形式と呼ばれる基本の型である。
sen.e: A hokyoin-to tower with a toshin, on which a square outline is not inscribed and one frame (kozama in Japanese) on its kiso is basic and is called Kansai style.
The basic style of the horin-to pagoda is called kansai style, which does not have a square frame inscribed on the toshin but has one kozama (a foliate panel) on the base.
The basic style of the horin-to pagoda is called kansai style, which does not have a square frame inscribed on the toshin but has one kozama (a foliate panel) on the base.

sen.j: 塔身に四角の輪郭を刻まれて基礎部に格座間（こうざま）が二つあるものは関東形式と呼ばれる。
sen.e: A hokyoin-to tower with a toshin on which a square outline is inscribed and two frames on its kiso is called Kanto style.
The so-called Kanto style involves a square frame inscribed on the toshin and two kozama (foliate panels) on the base.
The so-called Kanto style involves a square frame inscribed on the toshin and two kozama (foliate panels) on the base.

sen.j: 名称の通り、関西形式は関西地方に、関東形式は関東地方に分布する。
sen.e: As the names suggest, Kansai style is distributed throughout Kansai region and Kanto style in Kanto region.
As the names suggest, Kansai style is distributed throughout the Kansai region and Kanto style in the Kanto region.
As the names suggest, Kansai style is distributed throughout the Kansai region and Kanto style in the Kanto region.

sen.j: 太字は図中に記載あり
sen.e: Items in bold are illustrated in the picture.
Items in bold are illustrated in the picture.
Items in bold are illustrated in the picture.

sen.j: 宝篋印塔の基本形式は、以上の通りであるが、時代・地方により、多少の違いが見られる。
sen.e: The basic form of a hokyoin-to tower is as mentioned above but there are some variations depending on the period and the area.
The basic form of the hokyoin-to pagoda is as above, but there are some variations depending on the period and the area.
sen.cmt: a を the に修正し、ｔｏｗｅｒ を pagoda に修正しました。mentioned を削除し、意味を明確にするために、above の後をカンマで区切りました。
sen.e: The basic form of the hokyoin-to pagoda is as above, but there are some variations depending on the period and the area.

sen.j: 例えば頂上部の宝珠については、時代が下るとともに、膨らみが失われ、室町期・江戸期を通して先端が尖っていくという特徴がある。
sen.e: For example, a hoju on the top of a tower tended to lose its bulge as time went by and its point became sharp through the Muromachi and the Edo periods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For example, the sacred gems on the tops of the pagoda lost their bulbous shapes as time went by, with the tip becoming sharper through the Muromachi and into the Edo periods.
sen.cmt: a hoju を the sacred gem に統一修正し、top を複数形に修正しました。ｔｏｗｅｒ を pagoda に修正しました。tended to lose its bulge を lost their bulbous shape に、 its point became sharp を with the tip becoming shaper に修正しました。into を追記しました。
sen.e: For example, the sacred gems on the tops of the pagoda lost their bulbous shapes as time went by, with the tip becoming sharper through the Muromachi and into the Edo periods.

sen.j: （この特徴は宝珠全体のもので、先述の五輪塔・宝塔・石灯籠・擬宝珠（ぎぼし）においても同様である）。
sen.e: This characteristics is true of a whole kind of hoju, that is, it is the same as gorinto, hoto, ishidoro (stone lantern) and giboshi (ornamental top of a railing) mentioned previously.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（）は除きました。
sen.e: (This characteristic is common to sacred gems generally; it is the same as gorinto and hoto referred to above, ishidoro [stone lantern] and giboshi [ornamental top of a railing].)
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って括弧でとじ、合わせて括弧内括弧についても修正ました。is true of a を is common to に、hoju を sacred gem に修正しました。mentioned previously を referred to above に変更し、「先述」されたのは、五輪塔・宝塔だけなので、その位置を移動させました。
sen.e: (This characteristic is common to sacred gems generally; it is the same as gorinto and hoto referred to above, ishidoro [stone lantern] and giboshi [ornamental top of a railing].)

sen.j: 隅飾は、同じように時代が下るごとに、外側へ張り出す傾向があり、江戸期には極端に反り返る隅飾になった。
sen.e: Similarly sumikazari tended to project outwards as time went by and became extremely warped in the Edo period.
Similarly, sumikazari tended to project outwards as time went by and had an extremely warped shape by the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Similarly の後をカンマで区切り、 became extremely warped in を had an extremely warped shape by に修正しました。
sen.e: Similarly, sumikazari tended to project outwards as time went by and had an extremely warped shape by the Edo period.

sen.j: 基礎部下の基壇も、次第に返花座などの飾りをもたない方形石の基壇となる。
sen.e: Also 'kidan' (platform) under a kiso gradually became a square stone platform without ornament such as 'kaeribanaza' (turned flower seat).
Also 'kidan' (platform) under the kiso gradually changed to become a square stone platform without ornament such as 'kaeribanaza' (turned flower seat).
sen.cmt: a kiso を the kiso に修正しました。became を changed to become に修正しました。
sen.e: Also 'kidan' (platform) under the kiso gradually changed to become a square stone platform without ornament such as 'kaeribanaza' (turned flower seat).

sen.j: また、塔身・基礎部の大きさの違いをはじめ、塔身に種子 (唯識)、仏像のレリーフを刻む、二重輪郭をとるなど、塔によって様々な形態がある。
sen.e: In addition, from the difference in the size of toshin and kiso parts to the varieties such as toshin with inscribed 'shuji' (content of human unconsciousness in the consciousness-only theory) or a relief of Buddha statue, or with double outline, towers have various shapes and forms.

Also, there are various styles depending on the pagodas, including differences in the size of the body and base as well as the inscription of shuji (the characteristic one syllable word to depict the Bodhisattva) (yuishiki [consciousness-only, the basic doctrine of the Japanese Hosso school]) and a relief of Buddha on the body, and having a double outline.

Also, there are various styles depending on the pagodas, including differences in the size of the body and base as well as the inscription of shuji (the characteristic one syllable word to depict the Bodhisattva) (yuishiki [consciousness-only, the basic doctrine of the Japanese Hosso school]) and a relief of Buddha on the body, and having a double outline.

sen.j: 先述の通り、宝篋印塔はもとは密教系の石塔ではあったが、鎌倉期以降は宗派を超えて造立されるようになった。
sen.e: As mentioned before, hokyoin-to towers were originally a stone tower of Esoteric Buddhism but they started to be built after the Kamakura period, regardless of the religious school.
As previously noted, hokyoin-to pagodas were originally stone pagodas of Esoteric Buddhism, but they started to be built across sectarian lines after the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: As previously noted に修正しました。hokyoin-to towers を hokyoin-to pagodas に修正しました。 across sectarian lines に修正し、文意を明確にするために the Kamakura period を文末に移しました。
sen.e: As previously noted, hokyoin-to pagodas were originally stone pagodas of Esoteric Buddhism, but they started to be built across sectarian lines after the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 滅罪や延命などの利益から、追善（死後に供養すること）・逆修（生前にあらかじめ供養をすませること）の供養塔、墓碑塔として、五輪塔とともに多く造立された。
sen.e: Together with gorinto, many hokyoin-to towers were built to seek a blessing of lightening sins or longevity, as memorial or gravestone towers for 'tsuizen' (holding a memorial service after one's death), or 'gyakushu' (holding a memorial service prior to one's death).

To seek a blessing of lightening sins or longevity, many hokyoin-to pagodas were built together with gorinto, as memorial pagodas for 'tsuizen' (holding a memorial service after one's death) or 'gyakushu' (holding a memorial service prior to one's death) or gravestone pagodas.
sen.cmt: 部分的に入れ替え、合わせて数か所修正しました。（「追善」および「逆修」がかかるのは「供養塔」で、墓碑塔にはかかりません。）
sen.e: To seek a blessing of lightening sins or longevity, many hokyoin-to pagodas were built together with gorinto, as memorial pagodas for 'tsuizen' (holding a memorial service after one's death) or 'gyakushu' (holding a memorial service prior to one's death) or gravestone pagodas.

sen.j: 鎌倉地方の丘陵部に多く存在するやぐらには、宝篋印塔が置かれる場合や、宝篋印塔のレリーフが彫られている例がある。
sen.e: Some hokyoin-to towers or reliefs of hokyoin-to towers are seen in 'yagura' (graveyards) many of which are seen on hill areas in the Kamakura region,
Some hokyoin-to pagodas or reliefs of hokyoin-to pagodas are seen in 'yagura' (graveyards) many of which are located in hilly areas in the Kamakura region.
sen.cmt: towers を pagodas に修正しました。 seen on hill areas を located in hilly areas に修正しました。カンマをピリオドに修正しました。
sen.e: Some hokyoin-to pagodas or reliefs of hokyoin-to pagodas are seen in 'yagura' (graveyards) many of which are located in hilly areas in the Kamakura region.

sen.j: ほぼ、五輪塔と同じ意義で用いられたことが考えられる。
sen.e: They are considered to have been made for the same purpose as gorinto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are considered to have been made for the same purpose as gorinto.
They are considered to have been made for the same purpose as gorinto.

sen.j: しかし、作例は五輪塔よりも少ない。
sen.e: However the number of hokyoin-to towers or their reliefs is less than gorinto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However the number of hokyoin-to pagodas or their reliefs is less than gorinto.
sen.cmt: towers を pagodas に修正しました。
sen.e: However the number of hokyoin-to pagodas or their reliefs is less than gorinto.

tit.e: Monks of Ritsu sect and Stonemasons
Monks of the Ritsu sect and Stonemasons
Monks of the Ritsu sect and Stonemasons

sen.j: 石造宝篋印塔のような石造美術品、特に中世期のものを見るうえで、律宗僧及びその関係の石工たちの存在に注目しなければならない。
sen.e: When looking at stone construction arts such as stone-made hokyoin-to towers, especially ones in the Medieval period, you have to pay attention to monks of the Ritsu sect and related stonemasons.

When looking at stone construction arts such as stone-made hokyoin-to pagodas, especially ones in the Medieval period, they should be noted as the work of monks of the Ritsu sect and related stonemasons.
sen.cmt: towers を pagodas に修正しました。 you have to pay attention to を they should be noted as the work of に修正しました。
sen.e: When looking at stone construction arts such as stone-made hokyoin-to pagodas, especially ones in the Medieval period, they should be noted as the work of monks of the Ritsu sect and related stonemasons.

sen.j: 中世期は、平安期に比べて石造美術品の造立数は格段の数となった。
sen.e: In the Medieval period remarkable numbers of stone construction arts were produced compared to the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Medieval period remarkable numbers of stone construction arts were produced compared to the Heian period.
In the Medieval period remarkable numbers of stone construction arts were produced compared to the Heian period.

sen.j: 奈良の西大寺 (奈良市)の叡尊や忍性といった律宗僧の戒律復興運動が全国展開する。
sen.e: Monks of the Ritsu sect, such as Eison and Ninsho in Saidai-ji Temple in Nara, expanded the movement of a revival of religious precept nationwide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（奈良市）は除いて訳しました。
sen.e: A revival of religious precepts by monks of the Ritsu sect, such as Eison and Ninsho in Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City, expanded nationwide.
sen.cmt: 部分的に入れ替え、City を追記しました。precept を複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: A revival of religious precepts by monks of the Ritsu sect, such as Eison and Ninsho in Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City, expanded nationwide.

sen.j: 彼らが招いて、率いた石工たちにより、優れた石造美術品が残された。
sen.e: Stonemasons were invited and led by them left excellent stone construction artworks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Stonemasons who were invited by them left excellent stone construction artworks.
sen.cmt: were invited and led を who were invited に修正しました。
sen.e: Stonemasons who were invited by them left excellent stone construction artworks.

sen.j: 現在も律宗系寺院または律宗系寺院の廃寺の跡において、このような石造美術品が多い。
sen.e: You can still see such stone construction artworks in the temples and abandoned temples of the Ritsu sect.
There are still many such stone construction artworks now in the temples and abandoned temples of the Ritsu sect.
There are still many such stone construction artworks now in the temples and abandoned temples of the Ritsu sect.
